intro: Niphogeton azorelloides, commonly known as the Azorean nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the Azores. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades and tomatoes. The plant typically grows in rocky, coastal areas and has small, violet-colored flowers. Its leaves are ovate and covered in a fine, white pubescence. It is adapted to the humid, maritime climate of the Azores and plays a role in the local ecosystem.
